content:
Darryl L. Badley
(774) 415-6265 Spencer, MA [dtbadley0325@gmail.com](mailto:dtbadley0325@gmail.com)

SKILLS
Biomedical Engineering
Signal Processing
Proficient in 3D Modeling Softwares (Autocad/ SolidWorks)
COMSOL analysis
Proficient in SQL  
Proficient in Microsoft office and Google Drive
Machine Learning
Excellent communication and active listening skills
Customer Engagement and Relationships
Data Entry
Java
Python
MATLAB
Data Analysis
Leadership and Management
Excellent writing and comprehension skills
Excellent mathematical capabilities

EXPERIENCE
Lumere/GHX - Research Analyst
Current

* Providing subject matter expertise to evaluate various FDA approved medical devices to provide doctors, nurses, and health system executives life-saving data for them to make the best purchasing decisions.
* Utilizing medical product spend data provided by partners to provide evidence-based savings strategies and spend utilization insights.
* Interacting directly with customers to ensure their happiness by listening and understanding exactly what their problem is to best address it.
* Collecting product specific data from the FDA, peer-reviewed journals, and device manufacturers to allow clients to fully understand product functionality and adverse events.
* Communicating and networking with device manufacturers to gain key insider knowledge about their products that may not otherwise be able to be available.

ABBVIE - Signal Processing Scientist
March 2022 - November 2022

* Designed a novel algorithm aimed to diagnose and categorize Parkinson’s Disease in patients from the comfort of their home by using wearable Inertial measurement units (IMU).
* Utilized Machine Learning to predict with high confidence the progression of patient disease progression.
* Worked with Clinical Research Coordinators and Principal Investigators to effectively obtain and analyze clinical trial data.
* Presented my findings weekly to my department and lead discussions to lead us forward.

Worcester Polytechnic Institute - Research Assistant
August 2020 - January 2022

* Management - Led a team where we used C. elegans to investigate the optimization of deep brain stimulation dosing in FDA approved diseases.
* Created a microfluidic electrical stimulation apparatus capable of serial control via a single board computer.
* Used COMSOL to create detailed simulations of the electronic and fluidic properties of the device.
* Used industry standard microfabrication techniques to design and assemble microfluidic devices.
* Used industry standard laboratory techniques to maintain laboratory equipment and handle living animals.
* Programmed algorithms using MATLAB, Python, and Java to automate the experiment process and standardize results.

Center for the Neural Basis of Cognition - Research Intern
May 2020 - August 2020

* Communication - Coordinated with industry leading, multi-disciplinary teams as a liaison to ensure project progress.
* Used Python and MATLAB to design novel neural decoders.
* Investigated the effects of neuron dropping on the performance of the neural decoders that were designed.
* Analyzed the literature to get the necessary information in order to push the project further.

Worcester Polytechnic Institute - Safety Shuttle Supervisor
September 2019 - May 2020

* Management - Managed a department by handling human resources and pay, creating schedules for each employee, and working with school staff to ensure the continued success of the department.
* Provided transportation to students to ensure that they made it to and from their destinations safely.
* Wrote a program using Python and Excel that automatically tracked employee hours.
* Ensured employee wages were properly distributed by using Workday.

MISSION
My mission is to contribute my knowledge and skills in biomedical engineering, software engineering, and product development to create innovative solutions that improve people's lives. I strive to develop cutting-edge technologies that can bridge the gap between human beings and machines, ultimately leading to a better
